prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Part 1** **Construct a rectangular prism with a sloped side**. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and draw a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of 4 lines: - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.3333] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.3333], End Point = [0.0, 0.3333] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.3333], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] After drawing the 2D sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform the 2D sketch into 3D by setting the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 45.0] (to account for the 45 degree sloped side) and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch by 0.015 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. The final dimensions of this prism will be 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.015 units in height. **Intermediate CAD Part 2** **Construct a rectangular prism with flat top and bottom**. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.015]. For the sketch, create two new faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) and draw two separate loops (loop\\_1 on each face): Face 1: - loop\\_1: - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.015, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.015, 0.0], End Point = [0.015, 0.3333] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.015, 0.3333], End Point = [0.0, 0.3333] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.3333], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Face 2: - loop\\_1: - line\\_1: Start Point = [0.735, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.3333] - line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.3333], End Point = [0.735, 0.3333] - line\\_4: Start Point = [0.735, 0.3333], End Point = [0.735, 0.0] After drawing the 2D sketches, scale both by a factor of 0.75. Then, transform both 2D sketches into 3D by setting the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the first scaled 2D sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction; and then extrude the second scaled 2D sketch by 0.25 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. The final dimensions of this prism will be 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.25 units in height.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.3333]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.3333],"End Point":[0.0,0.3333]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3333],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.015,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.015]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.015,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.015,0.0],"End Point":[0.015,0.3333]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.015,0.3333],"End Point":[0.0,0.3333]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.3333],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.735,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.3333]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.3333],"End Point":[0.735,0.3333]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.735,0.3333],"End Point":[0.735,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.25,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Long, Thin, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The first part is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and no translation. Creating the sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Drawing the curves 1. Draw the first arc with the following points: - Start Point: (0, 0.0008) - Mid Point: (0.0002, 0.0002) - End Point: (0.0008, 0) 2. Draw the first line with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0008, 0) - End Point: (0.0205, 0) 3. Draw the second arc with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0205, 0) - Mid Point: (0.021, 0.0002) - End Point: (0.0213, 0.0008) 4. Draw the second line with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0213, 0.0008) - End Point: (0.0213, 0.0205) 5. Draw the third arc with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0213, 0.0205) - Mid Point: (0.021, 0.021) - End Point: (0.0205, 0.0213) 6. Draw the third line with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0205, 0.0213) - End Point: (0.0008, 0.0213) 7. Draw the fourth arc with the following points: - Start Point: (0.0008, 0.0213) - Mid Point: (0.0002, 0.021) - End Point: (0, 0.0205) 8. Draw the fourth line with the following points: - Start Point: (0, 0.0205) - End Point: (0, 0.0008) Creating loops 1. Create a loop with the first arc, the first line, and the second arc. 2. Create a loop with the second line, the third arc, the third line, and the fourth arc. Closing the loops 1. Close the first loop by connecting the last point of the second arc to the first point of the first arc. 2. Close the second loop by connecting the last point of the fourth arc to the first point of the second line. Scaling the sketch Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.0213. Extruding the sketch Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.75 units in the positive Z-direction to create the 3D model of the part. Describing the part The shape of the part is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length is 0.0213 units, the width is 0.0213 units, and the height is 0.75 units.</description>

<description><part\\_1> Shape description Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom. The sides of the prism are straight and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The prism is centered on the white background, with a height of approximately 0.75 units, a length of approximately 0.75 units, and a width of approximately 0.1 units. Coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1, 0.0] Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane (face\\_1) and draw the following loops. Loop\\_1 Loop\\_1 consists of the following lines: * line\\_1: A line from [0.0, 0.0145] to [0.3375, 0.0145] * line\\_2: A line from [0.3375, 0.0145] to [0.3375, 0.0] * line\\_3: A line from [0.3375, 0.0] to [0.35, 0.0] * line\\_4: A line from [0.35, 0.0] to [0.35, 0.0145] * line\\_5: A line from [0.35, 0.0145] to [0.75, 0.0145] * line\\_6: A line from [0.75, 0.0145] to [0.75, 0.0395] * line\\_7: A line from [0.75, 0.0395] to [0.0, 0.0395] * line\\_8: A line from [0.0, 0.0395] to [0.0, 0.0145] Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the positive Z-axis by a depth of 0.1 units, creating a new solid body. The final shape should match the initial description. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Set the boolean operation to 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'.</description>

Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4357. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2905, 0.0] The sketch for this part consists of a single face (face\\_1) with two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2) and zero connectors. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.288. The resulting shape is a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, as described.</description>

<description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side** **Step 1: Create a 2D Sketch** Create a new coordinate system for the first part. The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.0625. The description of part_1 is as follows - shape: rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side, length: 0.0625, width: 0.0625, height: 0.75. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions are 2 units long, 1 unit wide, and 0.5 units tall. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units.</description>
